text: Michael Godwin is a true Southern gentleman, who goes above and beyond to meet client expectations.  When I first walked into his store he stayed way after hours to meet my needs.  His recommendations were excellent and innovative, especially his "window perf sign process" that will give me one of the best storefronts in the Historic Prattville downtown.  His prices are excellent, and he was even willing to match national pricing from a big warehouse vendor for my real estate signs!  If you want small town service, big city professionalism and great pricing, Central Alabama Sign & Banner is your place.

name: Evita B
text:
Went in to get an outdoor retail sign. Gave my information and was told someone would come out and measure. They never did. I called about 3 weeks later and was told someone would come out that day to measure. Waited at the location all day until about 8pm. No one showed up. I've heard a similar story from another business owner about them never showing up or calling back. Decided to go with SignOps and they were very helpful, and got our sign made and up within a week of contacting them and approving the design. They handled everything and it looks perfect!

Response. "Perceived"? No one came to measure and he admitted he didn't come and measure the first time, citing the holidays. I visited the shop before the holidays and in 3 weeks time, no one measured or contacted me. After I called, he never came that day after saying he would. I was there all day, and no one measured and no one contacted me. I do not have any calls from this place and I gave my cellphone number and address. Place is like 10 to 15 minutes away. As I said, another business has had the same experience. People reading this review can decide for themselves from my "perceived" experience. Thank you and have a nice day.

resp.text: I am very sorry for your perceived experience.  One of our salesmen did go out and measure for your sign. After repeated attempts to contact you with no response on your part, we figured you decided to go another route.  If there is anything we can do for you in the future, please do not hesitate to contact us.

name: William Bradford
text: I specifically requested 8 separate 3.5" inch strips of vinyl cut, this way they could be applied as striped. Instead I recieved 8 strips on two sheets making it impossible to peel off one at a time let alone use it for my intended application. They were also 3.75" in width. When confronted with these concerns the only thing they could say was and I quote, "Well you've already paid for them." I refuse to do any more business with them...the lack of professionalism, and poor listening skills and the carelessness have left a foul taste in my mouth. So much for trying to support small hometown businesses.

resp.text:
Hey William,
We are out of town but I would like to talk to you about your experience. I am sorry and I think it was a big misunderstanding and would like to make this right. Our sales person thought the extra size was a bonus on your end. You have been a great customer and we don't want to lose your business. You have always been so fun to work with and I will correct this at no charge on Monday when we return from our business trip.

name: Brandy Contorno
text: Work was not performed as requested. Requested embroidered personalization on my unborn son's hospital outfits & diaper bag. Vinyl was applied instead of embroidery & totally ruined all 4 items. Fonts, colors, & sizing of personalization were also all wrong. Owner & employee were EXTREMELY rude about the entire situation & not once even offered a simple apology & refused to make this order right. When we refused to pay for the work performed since it wasn't what we requested, we were told that we would not be given our merchandise back that was purchased elsewhere until we paid. Had to repurchase all 4 items & take them to a different shop to have personalization done, costing us over $100 for a mistake that was not our fault. Will make sure EVERYONE knows the HORRIBLE work & customer service we received from this establishment.

resp.text: We are sorry for your issue. We worked with your mother on making these items and we were told to make them out of heat press. She chose the colors out of the heat press sample book for your items. She asked for the cheapest way to monogram where we told her…heat press. I agree embroidery looks better on a diaper bag but we make what the client orders. Your mother was happy with what we did when picking up the order but changed her mind after being verbally berated by you over the phone that it was not what you wanted.. We apologized the day the order was received several times. We apologized to you over the phone even thought we never spoke to you before hand. We made exactly what your mother ordered so yes we made her pay for it. I am going to say the moral of the story is if you want it done a certain way please order it yourself.

I was unaware that there was a problem and am very sorry you felt that we did not help you however, we were honest about your options and did all that we could do. Thank you!

name: Cindy Hafley
text: Michael’s customer service is atrocious. He is who did my transaction and he was so rude I was honestly stunned. He was literally sighing, rolling his eyes, got smart when I said I wanted to “mail” something (“You mean you want to SHIP it?”). You would have thought it was the end of the world when he had to verify my address and it turned out I needed to change it. So unnecessary. I was also shocked when I looked at his name tag and it said he has been there since 1999. From the other reviews I’ve read, I’m not the only person treated like this at this location, so fedex obviously doesn’t care how their employees treat their customers. Trent is great though, for the record.

name: Aries Gates
text:
I rate this experience as a one because I have never been discriminated against in a fedex store until today! I was shipping to packages off today, one to my mortgage company and another to At&t. When I got to the counter the representative told me that AT&T system was down but she would check to see if  it was back up and running. It was still down so she directed me to the UPS store about 1.2 miles away and I went to go get in the car to call ATT before going to UPS to see if this was a outage all over it just Fedex Kinkos. The ATT representative told me they didn’t have a issue so I go back in the store to see if their system was back up. A older lady that I helped in the store before leaving stopped me and said the Caucasian guy behind me earlier had a package he was shipping back to At&t as well. The representative told him that the system was down but she would hold it for him and ship it when the system came back up. I asked the representative when I walked back in the store was the system back up, she replied no it’s still down. I asked could she hold my package and ship it when it come back up, she replied they aren’t allowed to do this.

I replied but you just did it for the Caucasian man who was sending a package to At&t to. She looked shocked!  She replied she isn’t suppose to do that but my problem is you did do it & he was behind me. You sent me to UPS but you didn’t send him! Do you know how this makes me feel (small very small) because I’m Black I can go to UPS but because he is white you can hold it for him and ship it later. I have always used fedex and I’m very disappointed in how I was discriminated against today but you guys will be hearing from me soon. My name is Markita Gates and this took place between 12:30pm & 1:00pm, the guy went to the counter right after me at 12:41pm. This is unacceptable!

name: Rob “Deacon Yomouf” Allbanks
text: Today was a good day! Ask for Leslie, she works!

name: K’Shira Hinkle
text: The associate that I spoke with on the phone is in need of some type of customer interaction training. I was asking about speaking with someone that can talk to a driver about a delivery that is scheduled for today and he said there’s no way to get that done. After I suggested that they implemented a new policy for there to be a way to contact the drivers he then tells me that they don’t deal with the drivers because that location is print and ship only. I then asked why he didn’t inform me of that and give me the number or transfer me to someone that could contact the drivers and he began to get rude. I asked for his name several times and he wouldn’t tell me. Then he put me on hold for the customer service line. Get it together FedEx

name: John Higginbotham
text: I would not recommend this facility for your shipping needs. FedEx in Alabama is a joke. Multiple upon multiple damaged packages and the customer service here is absolutely terrible.

text:
Went into the store to get a passport photo, simple right?
Not to the employees who didn't want to act enthused to help with anything. First and last visit in one day!

And I found my dog!! The flyers were beautiful and clear. I will definitely return next time I need something printed!

name: Maya Madden
text: I had a really difficult situation getting my package through customs and needed someone to be as fired up as me about it. I called several international agents and none knew what was going on, I was so worried I was going to lose my merchandise. Amber was really the only one who rose up to the plate and got my situation handled. She went above and beyond calling international on my behalf and my package is safe and sound. THANK YOU AMBER!

I mean, they had a stamp and an envelop and I made 4 overly priced copies, but could not scan them and they couldn't mail my letter for me and the workers didn't seem to want to be there but at least they had a stamp! Is there tax on stamps? I think they charged me tax on stamps?!? I should call the Postmaster. I needed to get the Paternity DNA results to my cousin cuz she was insistent it was my baby but I knew it was her brother's! Maynard struck agian

text: I went to my local Ship Center to see if I can ship  a poster to CA. It took the "Store Manager" 7 minutes to finally tell me it would be $50 using there "Super Saver option"  to ship a poster from AL to CA! The so called "store manager" was yawning the whole time I was waiting for him to figure out the shipment details it was (10AM). I went to the post office and shipped for $7.

name: K Melissa Swearingen
text:
I called ahead and spoke with Ellis about passport photo information, and he was the person who assisted me in person, albeit all of the employees were very kind and helpful.

I will be back to this location!

name: Clayetta Montee
text:
UPDATE:  I went to this location yesterday just to look and see if this most unpleasant employee is there.  As happens with large corporations too often, she was PROMOTED to driver.  I couldn't believe a promotion instead of demotion was her reward for running customers off.  However, since she is no longer in the store, if they accept my perfectly good boxes, I will use this branch again.  if not, I will continue to ship through my employer.

PREVIOUS POST: This used to be my favorite shipper and favorite FED EX location.  I even have my own personal Fed Ex account.  However about a year ago Fed Ex must have brought in a new female day manager or supervisor and she behaves like a shrew.  I was believe her name was Helen.  She misquotes Fed Ex's shipping policy and refuses to use "banker's" boxes and other good boxes that are actually more sturdy than she sells at that outlet. She says it is FedEx's policy and I have since found out - it is not FedEx policy, but may be the individual store policy.  But she says it is FedEx policy.  However, she is most loud and belligerent and actually refuses to ship unless in boxes "like she sells" and pulls off the shelf "because Fed Ex will no longer accept those boxes".  Not true.  She won't accept the boxes.  She claims my boxes are not as sturdy (not true) and it is FED EX's policy not to accept those boxes.  Not true.  I've checked Fed Ex's shipping and packing policies and my boxes are very acceptable...and they are more sturdy than the boxes she is trying to force me to buy.  I will no longer ship there but ship through my work and have the charges deducted form my payroll.  Fed Ex is happy to pick up my boxes at my work without trying to make me buy boxes from Fed Ex.  My work place ships many boxes like my boxes (that's where I get my boxes) without any problem.  Someone needs to retrain or terminate the weekday supervisor or manager at this office.  I have read of many complaints about the personnel at FedEx-Kinko locations since Kinko and Fed Ex combined their locations.  I will not go back to this location with Helen there.  When I can't use my work place for shipping (as when the boxes too heavy for me to take in), I have driven 35 miles round trip to drop off my boxes elsewhere instead of dealing with this unpleasant person...what a shrew.

text: These people are Super-Heroes !! I walked into the store with MUCH anxiety related to a return shipping policy that I had never dealt with. The staff at this Fed-Ex Store made my fears VANISH ! They admitted that they had not dealt with the specific on-line vendor I was dealing with but QUICKLY found the needed information, printed my shipping label and had my box on the rack waiting for the truck. name: Terry Tuell
text: I wanted to ship my packages for my company today. I had three labels to use by today October 26, 2020. When I got to the FedEx print and ship Center the employee he had no name tag told me my labels had expired. I told him that the correspondence from FedEx said that I could ship by today. He got an attitude with me in front of everybody that was in there and said there’s nothing I can do about it you wanna come back here and look at the screen.We will not be using FedEx in the future for our business shipping needs. Goodbye.

name: Hyman Flemings
text: I called the store to ask for one of your team members to print out some documents. I had needed them asap because I had a customer waiting at my dealership. The woman on the phone(not TIA) was rude and short with me, then she hung up. To make a long story short I called back and got a lady by the name of Tia. I explained the previous called and assured me she'd have my documents when I arrived. Just as promised she had them as soon as I walked in. Now the kind of customer service that Tia displayed made me a future customer.

text: Tia, Ben, and Chris are super helpful and patient with project printing needs. I was at a loss when I went in and ended up with 5 beautiful posters. I could not have done it without them. Their manager, Jake, is very supportive of his team.

text: I came in this place for the first time to print a copy of a pdf from my phone, I had never done this before and needed a little help to go about it so I turned to this woman working there (Leticia) and she only told me what I had already read on the screen not how it works. I’m not completely computer savvy so I asked her how I go about things after and she repeated the same thing to me in a very rude manner. She acted the same way in a smart attitude but still “smiling” to others coming in the business which to me is unacceptable behavior for an employee. If I ever need to do this again I’ll definitely pick a different destination to do it.

text: Man these guys are awesome. I own a trucking company and I use these guys for all my office needs as I hate office work. Super nice super helpful to the point where I feel like I take advantage of them

text: Great place for passport photos. After having passport photos taken at Walgreens that made me look like a drug addict, I tried my luck here. They have a nice camera, friendly staff, and gave me a professional looking passport photo. Lighting makes a big difference!

name: The Woke Unicorn
text:
I shop here often. I processed a print order from the FedEx Office app on my iPhone. The order was ready in under 20 minutes (is was a small order, but still at a peak time of 12:30).

Staff is helpful and there are plenty of self serve printers, copiers, and workstation computers for customers to use for quick service.

name: Marshelia Lovelace-Evans
text: I'm sitting in my manufactured home and no one knocks or blows, I would have heard it. My insurance man comes about fifteen minutes afterwards and knocks. I heard him!! Why is that? It's because he didn't knock. He left a tag on my screen door. Not on the inside door. The screen door was unlocked because I was expecting this wheel for my Harley Davidson!!! Get out and knock!! I work for the postal system, if you blow and you don't see an animal, you get out and make sure you knock!! He never attempted to deliver, he just put the door tag on the outside of the screen door and left!! That's not good business!! Then he goes back to Mobile!! I never try to give bad reviews because I work for the postal system but DO YOUR JOB!!!!! Especially, if I'm sitting and waiting. Just because you pull up in the yard and no one knows you're out there does NOT constitute you doing your job!! KNOCK AND SOMEONE WILL HEAR YOU!! Thank you!!

name: Paul Miller
text: If you really need assistance with your project other than to be told "go over to that machine".  Then you should go to Office Depot or Staples.

name: Heather Chastain
text: I do not recommend using this store for any services. Very unprofessional staff and prices are way too high. I went there just wanting to ship a package and the lady working in the front with dark hair was rude to me from the second I walked in. She looked at my package and rolled her eyes. I asked her a simple question about shipping and she made a huge scene and yelled at me, embarrassing me in front of the entire store. VERY unprofessional and rude. I ended up just leaving and going across the street to the UPS store, where they were very quick and professional.

name: Draven Brown
text:
Jake is rude and hangs up on you simply for asking if your package is that their location.
Me, "Hey, I was calling to inquire if my package is at your location."
Jake, "I don't know."
Pause.
Jake, "What's your name?"
Me, "D**** B*"
Places me on hold for 2-3 minutes clicks on then hangs up.
I call back immediately for it to ring 6-8times before another associate answers only to find out that it's not at this location and that they don't know where it is.

text:
USA Signs & Graphics is the real deal!!  They are the most complete signs & graphics business on the Gulf Coast!  Brand new facility designed specifically to do the AWESOME WORK they do:

1.).  INDOOR, temperature controlled, CUSTOM vehicle-wrapping of commercial large vehicles, boats, cars, motorcycles, etc.  They can do partial or full vinyl wrapping.  Up to 10 year warranty on their high end 3M-material work!  Want some cool custom stripes or custom graphics on your new car??  No worries!!  Their graphic designers are AWESOME!!  Best prices around!!!

2.). CUSTOM STORE-FRONT & STREET-FRONT SIGNS.  They can custom design, manufacture and install just about any type of sign, including large LED Screen signs on building-fronts or secured at curb side.  Additionally, they are experts with cutting and shaping aluminum to create tough, weather resistant signs.  If this wasn’t enough, they powder coat their sign-metal “in-house” to provide even more protection to the sign!!  Wow!!!

3.).  BANNERS.  Custom made!!  Just give them your ideas and they will make your banner come to life!!  Super quick service using top-notch technology!

4.). Garment printing using superb screen printing and sublimation technology!

5.). Quality, custom embroidery on all types of gear!!

6.). Custom business promotional-items such as mugs, calendars, etc.

As a bonus, their customer service is amazing!!

It’s awesome to have all of these signs & graphics services under one roof in S. Baldwin County, Alabama!!  One stop shopping for your business, school, athletic league or personal needs!!!!

text:
Well, here's the short version: ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND.
To give you an idea of the attention to detail paid here: Gavin does 100% of the work himself, and that's normally 2 cars per day, max. But when I called him on a Wednesday trying to get my Tesla done for a Saturday show, he made it happen, despite being booked solid. I dropped her off at 5 on Thursday and he rolled it in to get started that night, and the next morning the job was done.
Not only does it look AMAZING, but I'm running my AC a good 10 degrees warmer to achieve the same comfort. These brutal summer days were pushing it to the limit, even with a fresh recharge, but now I can actually set it to the temp I want and it'll get there instead of struggling. So, not just a great aesthetic improvement, but a real boost to efficiency, meaning I can drive farther on a charge and spend less overall. I'd go back in a heartbeat, and I'd recommend him to anyone I know as well.

They literally sprayed what looked like gallons of this crap on my windows and let it run down through the interior of the door onto the ground. Is that not going to screw up my electrical?

Meanwhile, the woman who was telling everybody what to do was nothing short of a witch. She kept shouting at people, cursing, and was very rude to me. One of the tint guys was making fun of the rims on my car while another kept spitting tobacco juice on the ground all around it. Then the owner lit up a cigarette and went to work on my window, blowing smoke all in my interior.

Why should I pay for this??? Incompetent staff, rude management, and an overall really bad experience. Don't waste your time. There are plenty of good tint shops in town without fooling with these people.

text: If I could score lower than 1 star, I would. For starters, my boyfriend dropped my car off on a Monday Morning with the promise that the turn around would be no more than 24 hours. As the days pass, he called for an update. After having several phone calls ignored, he finally went up there on Wednesday. The owner had a million excuses as to why the car wasn't complete, while he's sitting outside smoking a cigarette (doing nothing). He then told my boyfriend that he swears it will be done by 5pm the following day. My boyfriend went to get the car at 4:45 and it STILL was not complete, there was 1 window without tint. Of course, my boyfriend is upset and when he expressed his disappointment,  the owner cursed him out like it was his fault. Friday rolls around, it's after lunch and my car is STILL NOT FINISHED😠😠!!  MIND YOU, MY CAR HAS BEEN AT HIS SHOP SINCE MONDAY!!! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE. If you pay with credit card they'll ask for a "Cash Deposit" 🤔🤔 I will never refer anyone to them or do business with them EVERRRRR again

Finally the work was finished and I had to have them come back out at threat of lawsuit to correct mistakes. Do not use this company!

name: Eli K
text:
This was absolutely the worst experience I've ever had with any car related shop. From the start, I was uneasy about the experience, but I went ahead with it. Huge mistake. I drove by today and a woman who said she was the owner's friend and acting manager waited on me. I asked her to inspect my car to put tint on the driver and passenger windows only. She inspected them and we agreed on a tint grade and a price. Then I walked down the street to the library to wait. About an hour later I decided to head back, and got a call from the manager on my way. She was agitated, and demanded to know if the car had ever had tint on it before. I replied that it may have, I bought it used. She said that they had already started applying tint to one window when they discovered that there was residue from old tint below the window sill. When I got back to the shop, the manager was in a frenzy. She pointed out the residue, and kept going on about how they had "wasted $50 worth of tint". I remained calm and asked them to finish the job. She said they would have to charge me $10 per window extra as a cleanup fee. I refused, saying it was their mistake and they should have inspected the windows more closely before starting (they are the experts, after all). She became very upset and began to shout, again blaming it on me for not telling her about the residue (which, again, was below the windowsill line and not visible). I stood my ground and insisted that it's not my job to know everything, that's why I brought it to a professional. She blew up, began to curse, shout, and refused to look at me in the eye. She shouted at the tint specialist to reassemble my car and send me away. I knew it would cost me even more at another tint shop to have them clean up the messed up tint that was already on my window from Tint Spectrum, so I reluctantly asked the tint specialist what it would take to get the job done right and get be out. He said it would take another $20, so I agreed to pay it. This time, I sat down in the shop and watched them the entire time. I'm not a tint expert by any means, but in my humble opinion, neither are these guys. One of them (who I later found out was the owner) was eating pizza over the hood of my car and asking me whether it was pink or red (it's obviously red). The tint specialist who was working on my car had to rip the tint from the passenger's window, replace it, install tint on the driver's side, rip it off and replace it, and then replace the tint on the passenger's side AGAIN. I'm not sure what he kept messing up, but if each one of those sheets was $50 worth of tint, he easily wasted over $200 worth. The manager continued to stomp around the shop shouting and cursing. The owner didn't seem to care. The tint specialist left lart "3M" logos on my window's right in the middle. The manager asked me if I wanted those removed (who in the world would WANT 3M logos in the middle of their window?).

When it was all said and done, my final bill was $140 before tax, which was $20 higher than agreed upon earlier that morning due to absolutely no fault of my own. The manager remained rude and loud the entire time, and I must have waited in the shop for well over an hour after I got back from the library. The manager offered no apology other than something about "didn't mean to snap earlier". I don't think there is anything in the world that could make me go back to this place or recommend it. The manager is rude, loud, inappropriate and unfair. The staff are very slow, appear to be outrageously incompetent, and are all dirty on top of that (the tint specialist kept spitting tobacco juice on the ground right behind my car). The owner didn't seem to care about anything. I think the quality of the tint is good, since it's 3M. But the service and the installation quality were absolutely not even worth the one star I am forced to grant them. Do not take your car to this place. You will regret it, especially if you have to deal with the manager.

text:
The only reason I give 5 stars is only because of one person and only one person, Penny. They built a sign for my gas station and it was something wrong with it. I contacted Steve and he promised to fix the problem. after couple of weeks he even did not pick up his phone and he never returned our call back. I contacted the store and spoke to Penny on the phone. she fixed our problem as fast as she could. she kept me as a customer and only because of her, I might go back there. It is so disrespectful when you do not pick up your phone on a customer who tipped you $100.00 for another job couple of months ago Steve. you should learn the customer service from Penny, how to do your job, keep your customers in this market and making sure they are happy.
Thank you Penny...
(update in response to Dear Steve)
I wish you guys the best in your business as well, also in case nobody get it in a wrong way, my project didn't assigned to another team by you, My project got ignored by you for 2 weeks same as my 4 phone calls and voicemails, So I decided to call the shop instead of your cellphone to resolve the issue and thanks god Penny fixed my problem.
Thank you

name: Shannon Mason
text:
The Office of Marketing & Public Relations at University of Mobile use FastSigns exclusively, because they are true to their name – we get quality signs very fast! The team at FastSigns, especially Pauline, is incredible to work with, throughout the entire process. Their customer service is excellent and some of the best I have ever worked with! Pauline is very personable and approachable, and always works to get us the best pricing on quality products. She goes the extra mile to get to know our projects in order to make our sometimes extravagant visions come to life. She is always able to be reached by phone or email, and responds quickly with estimates. Her staff has adopted this mindset as well, as they ensure that everything from the installations to the billing process is as smooth as possible.

Frank, one of the installers, is the best in the business! He works long hours and always does our installations. We look forward to seeing him on campus, because we know that if Frank is here, it will be done right! We can always count on him to be professional and do a great job.

Outside of University of Mobile, I have used FastSigns for several personal projects and every time they excel and meet my demands! No matter the project, Pauline & her staff are the only name we trust in the sign business to take on our signage requests. They can just about do it all! It’s always a pleasure to work with them!

text: I had an awful experience dealing with this company and will never go back. The so-called co-owner, Pauline I believe her name is, took it upon herself to take on my order. I was in charge of the decorations for my 20-year high school reunion, and one of my tasks was to have posters made from our old year book to set up for a display. I figured Fastsigns would be the place to go since they specialize in that type of work. I was assured that the posters would be of high quality and on time. However, when I came in to pick up my posters, they weren’t even ready and were horribly distorted. I was very perturbed to find this out seeing as how I was spending over $300.00 on these posters. Pauline, who was in charge, wouldn’t even personally confront me about this issue, she had one of her employees who was more helpful than Pauline was, bare the grunt. Pauline was also unprofessional as I saw her talk down to one of her employees and treated her poorly right in front of me! Needless to say, I took my business elsewhere to SignPro and they did a wonderful job in a fraction of the time.

resp.text: Your only order for six polo shirts in August, 2020 used a printed transfer red which which we changed per your request to a darker red at no charge. Sorry I meant to say that in the first email"  We have not heard from you since. We assumed you had changed your mind or made other plans as the two day email exchange involved some 8 messages between you and the designer.  We apologize for not following up with you to see if you got the last of four emails from the designer.  We will offer you a 20% discount on this order of 12 screen printed polo shirts to assure you we can and will meet our customer's  screen printed apparel needs. name: Daniel Noll
text:
Let me tell you a story about these guys. This story takes place in the relatively small parking lot of the hotel I am staying in.

Before we get started though, know that I tried to resolve this issue directly with the company. The responses I received from them began with a man named "Andrew" responding to my initial email with "who the heck is this".

In the attached pictures you will see what their workers did. Things the company clearly considers acceptable, because their attitude towards the situation was condescending at best.

Thing #1: You'll see 3 trailers here. One is a different company, one is Scott's Services (the middle one) and one is unmarked. It's not easy to see how many spots they are taking up, but at least 6.

The drivers were there, and were aware of the problems they were causing. People were actively driving around the lot trying to find parking spots. You can also see the company name on the truck here.

There is another truck here that is apparently also theirs. After the front desk agent of the hotel asked them to stop blocking parking spaces, they refused, claiming they were stuck. After the agent left they had a good laugh about it, and then moved into the unmarked truck.

Thing #2: This is the other side of the parking lot. Another of their vehicles. A much smaller vehicle. One capable of fitting into a single space, and yet they managed to take up two with this one as well. Surely this truck was not stuck as well. What stopped them from fixing this one and freeing up a space?

Upon reporting this behavior to the company, I was told by the person named Andrew that I had a personal problem, and that the hotel should deal with the issue if they feel they need to. I should also stop trying to get hard working people in trouble just because I cannot park where I want. Because everyone knows only Scott's Services' workers are hard working - none of the other patrons of the hotel they inconvenienced were hard working people as well.

In the adult world we do not get "in trouble"; We get held accountable for our actions. The company's refusal to hold their employees accountable for their behavior is a clear declaration that the behavior is condoned by the company, and that these actions accurately reflect the values of Scott's Services.

Consider these things when you consider working with them. This is how they might choose to behave.
